title: The threat to Britain isn't Brexit – it's Jeremy Corbyn's Labour Party
text:
For much of the last three years, I looked on, as CEO of the Conservative Party, as parliament and the country tore themselves apart over Brexit. I stepped down in July but still believe the Conservative Party is tasked with guiding the country through an existential threat.

That threat is not Brexit, however, but Labour. Britain will survive leaving the EU, especially with a deal. But the market based socio-economic contract which has underpinned our society for so long, which Labour would destroy, is fundamental, as is the preservation of democratic due process.

It is vital that Parliament votes for the Brexit deal now on the table. If it doesn’t then the extremist Labour Party of Jeremy Corbyn,...
description: For much of the last three years, I looked on, as CEO of the Conservative Party, as parliament and the country tore themselves apart over Brexit.
